article.title: K2-139 b: a low-mass warm Jupiter on a 29-day orbit transiting an active K0 V star

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the K2 light curve for K2-139, as extracted by Luger et al. (2016), primarily illustrate?
What is the purpose of the ALFOSC Bessel R-band image in the context of the article?
choices: To identify stellar companions of K2-139
To determine the spectral type of K2-139
To measure the rotational period of K2-139
To estimate the contamination factor from nearby stars in the K2 photometry

multiple_choice_question.text: What information can be derived from the peaks present in the Generalized Lomb-Scargle periodogram of the radial velocity (RV) data?
choices: The presence of additional planets in the system
The mass of the planet K2-139b
The orbital period of the planet K2-139b
The stellar rotation period and its harmonics potentially affecting the RV signal

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the significance of K2-139b\'s position in the mass-radius diagram for warm Jupiters?
choices: It suggests a lack of a significant solid core.
It implies a composition primarily of heavy elements.
It indicates that K2-139b is among the lowest-mass well-characterized warm Jupiters.
It reveals an unusually large radius for its mass, suggesting a young age.
